meanings.definition: To spread or promote (ideas, information, etc.) widely for the purpose of influencing opinions
meanings.sent1: The government propagandized the benefits of recycling to encourage more people to participate.
meanings.sent2: During the war, both sides propagandized their citizens to support the cause.
meanings.sent3: The aliens propagandized Earthlings to believe that cats were the rulers of the universe.
meanings.sent4: Her social media posts were so propagandized that they seemed like a never-ending stream of advertisements.
meanings.sent5: The teacher propagandized the importance of reading by creating a magical library in the classroom.

meanings.sent1: The dictator propagandized the entire population to ensure they remained loyal to him.
meanings.sent2: The prisoners of war were propagandized with false information to confuse them.
meanings.sent3: The children were propagandized by the talking animals in the storybook to always eat their vegetables.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was being propagandized by the constant barrage of advertisements on TV.
meanings.sent5: The company propagandized its employees with motivational speeches to boost productivity.
